    • Constructor Detail

      • DBMain

        public DBMain(java.lang.String h,
              java.lang.String u,
              java.lang.String p)
        creating a Database Class creates a connection to an SQLServer
        Parameters:
        h - the host address - could be a domain name or ip address (ex. "localhost/schema" or "192.168.1.15/schema")
        u - username of the user that has access to the database host
        p - password of the username.

      • parseStudentsAnswers

        private java.util.HashMap<QuestionInExam,java.lang.Integer> parseStudentsAnswers(java.lang.String string,
                                                                                 java.util.ArrayList<QuestionInExam> questions)
        This function will convert answers from database to objects by organizing them For this to work the answers must be kept in the database in a cetain way answers will appear as a long string and look like following: qaqaqa/ ... before every answer there is the letter 'a' also before every question there is the letter 'q'
        Parameters:
        string - of answers kept in database in described matter
        questions - the arraylist of questionsInExam with their points assigned to them
        Returns:
        an organized HashMap of questions in exam including the question and the students answer
